articles.title: Pixel's 'Now Playing' is becoming a real app, but not for everyone - Android Authority
articles.description: Google is spinning Pixel's Now Playing feature into a standalone app on the Play Store, but not everyone will be able to download it.

articles.title: Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster ‘Alchemist Introduction’ trailer - Gematsu
articles.description: Inti Creates has released a new trailer for hybrid 2D action and strategy game Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster introducing the Alchemist class.

articles.title: 5 MagSafe Gadgets You'll Use Every Day - bgr.com
articles.description: If you think MagSafe on your iPhone is only for wireless charging, you might be surprised by the variety of gadgets it supports, such as SSDs, mounts, and more.

articles.title: Bloodstained: The Scarlet Engagement creative director Shutaro Ida dies at age 52 - Gematsu
articles.description: Shutaro Ida, creative director behind the upcoming Bloodstained: The Scarlet Engagement, has died at age 52 after a one-and-a-half years battle with cancer, developer ArtPlay announced.

articles.title: New ClickFix attack abuses nslookup to retrieve PowerShell payload via DNS - BleepingComputer
articles.description: Threat actors are now abusing DNS queries as part of ClickFix social engineering attacks to deliver malware, making this the first known use of DNS as a channel in these campaigns.

articles.title: Apple launching 5+ new products over the next several weeks - 9to5Mac
articles.description: Apple is reportedly preparing to launch several new products soon, including a low-cost MacBook, M5 MacBook Air, iPhone 17e, and more.

articles.title: Windows 11 KB5077181 fixes boot failures linked to failed updates - BleepingComputer
articles.description: Microsoft says it has resolved a Windows 11 bug that caused some commercial systems to fail to boot with an "UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME" error after installing recent security updates, with the fix delivered in the February 2026 Patch Tuesday update.

articles.title: Longtime NPR host David Greene sues Google over NotebookLM voice - TechCrunch
articles.description: The longtime host of NPR’s “Morning Edition,” is suing Google, alleging that the male podcast voice in the company’s NotebookLM tool is based on him.

articles.title: A bunch of first-party Nintendo Switch games are now on sale - Nintendo Everything
articles.description: Nintendo has put eight different Switch games on sale, including Super Mario RPG, Xenoblade Chronicles X, Zelda: Link's Awakening, and more.

articles.title: It’s time for Apple to let go of 60Hz displays - 9to5Mac
articles.description: It’s been nearly a decade since the introduction of the first 120Hz ProMotion display, if you can believe that. It...

articles.title: Software Development On The Nintendo Famicom In Family BASIC - Hackaday
articles.description: Back in the 1980s, your options for writing your own code and games were rather more limited than today. This also mostly depended on what home computer you could get your hands on, which was a mar…

articles.title: Gemini app makes sharing more prominent in chats, boosts icon - 9to5Google
articles.description: Gemini for Android has rolled out tweaks to the chat page that make sharing and the overflow menu more prominent actions.

articles.title: Couple goes viral after inviting Sony to their wedding and receiving free PlayStation games - Dexerto
articles.description: A couple has gone viral after revealing that Sony responded to their wedding invite by sending them a bundle of free PlayStation games.

articles.title: China Built A Shape-Shifting Robot That Can Grow Like A Human - bgr.com
articles.description: A new robot out of China can change its shape by inflating or deflating, and its creators hope it can be put to use for search and rescue operations.

articles.title: Rayman 30th anniversary has save data bug and Ubisoft support says post launch support has ended - My Nintendo News
articles.description: Update: Apparently a Ubisoft employee has now said on Reddit that post-launch support has not ended. Though it’s not clear when this issue will be resolved. Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition was…

articles.title: This 100TB cloud storage deal means never deleting anything ever again - SFGATE
articles.description: Get 100TB of cloud storage from Internxt for $849.97 (MSRP $9,900). No coupon is needed. This deal ends February 22.

articles.title: Man aims to cross the Atlantic using 3-foot boat smaller than an airline seat in adventure of a lifetime - supercarblondie.com
articles.description: This man wants to cross the Atlantic from Canada to Ireland in one of the smallest boats the world has ever seen - it's a far cry from luxury superyachts

articles.title: This 'Perfect' $6 Amazon Gadget Adds MagSafe Support To Your Kindle - bgr.com
articles.description: Amazon has several MagSafe rings that you can buy and attach to the back of your Kindle. You can then use MagSafe accessories with your e-reader.

articles.title: Mario Tennis Fever review for Nintendo Switch 2 - Nintendo Everything
articles.description: Mario Tennis Fever is Camelot's latest Mario sports outing, and this review explains why it's a step in the right direction for the series.
